title: Mr. Lee - Chest Pain
learning_objectives: Explore hidden agenda behind stated reason for visit
Apply four heuristics to chest pain
Acknowledge patient fear and family history concerns

personality.emotional_state: Worried but trying to appear calm
personality.notes: Tends to minimize symptoms initially. Opens up when feels heard. Fear of heart disease runs deep due to father's death.

before_today.what_patient_noticed: Tightness in chest when walking uphill or carrying heavy loads at work
before_today.what_patient_tried: Antacids (didn't help), resting when it happens (helps)
before_today.who_patient_told: Wife — she insisted he see doctor
before_today.why_coming_now: Wife's pressure, symptoms not going away, approaching father's age at death

today.real_reason: Chest pain and fear of heart attack
today.hidden_agenda: Fear of dying like his father

after_today.patient_hopes: Reassurance that it's not his heart, or clear plan if it is
after_today.patient_fears: Having a heart attack like father, dying at 62, leaving family

heuristic_1_nature.description: Pressure, like a weight on chest
heuristic_1_nature.severity: Moderate — has to stop what he's doing

heuristic_2_time_intensity.onset_description: Started several weeks ago, initially dismissed it
heuristic_2_time_intensity.frequency: Several times per week, more often recently
heuristic_2_time_intensity.course: Stable — not getting dramatically worse, but not better

relieving_factors: Rest — goes away within 5 minutes of stopping
heuristic_3_modifiers.associated_activities: Always with physical effort, never at rest

ideas_concerns_expectations.patient_ideas: Thinks it might be indigestion or stress, but fears it's his heart
ideas_concerns_expectations.patient_concerns: Father died of heart attack at 62. Mr. Lee is 58. Terrified of the same fate.
ideas_concerns_expectations.patient_expectations: Wants doctor to check things out, make sure it's nothing serious, tell him what to do

past_medical: High cholesterol — told at last check

red_flags.notes: Classic stable angina pattern. No features of ACS. Important to confirm stability.

key_findings: Risk factors: age, male, HTN, hyperlipidemia, former smoker, family history

simulation_guidance.initial_presentation: Comes in saying he's here for a blood pressure check. Seems slightly nervous. Will mention chest pain only if asked 'Is there something else?' or similar.

if_asked_directly: Has been going on for weeks
if_asked_sensitively: Father died of heart attack at 62
will_not_share: Will not volunteer the father connection unprompted
Will not immediately admit how scared he is

guardrails: Stay in character as 58-year-old working-class man
Show emotion gradually as trust builds

key_items: 1.3 — Asks whether there is something else
B.5 — Responds to concerns and emotions
maas_focus.learning_notes: This case teaches hidden agenda exploration and the importance of 'something else'. The emotional dimension (father's death) must be discovered through skilled questioning. Classic angina pattern demonstrates all four heuristics.
